posts.author: Yunim
posts.content:
It depends on the type of aura/AoE.

The aura mentioned in that thread damages you when you enter it and every round that you remain in the aura. Every time the aura damages somebody it will count as combat, so you will remain in combat for as long as someone is inside the aura. In that case it will prevent you from getting paralyzed by Death Attack unless the assassin uses a ranged attack to stay outside of the aura.

Other auras/AoEs such as Battletide or Darkness only trigger when you enter the aura/AoE. In that case you'll be in combat for the first round or two after an enemy enters the aura/AoE but after a couple of rounds you'll leave combat provided that nothing else enters the aura/AoE. This means you won't be safe from getting paralyzed by a Death Attack, but it also means that if you're an assassin you can paralyze something that entered and left combat by simply waiting.

If you worried about PvP then an aura won't really help though. A smart assassin can either use a ranged weapon to attack you from outside of the aura or enter the aura and then wait until you're out of combat before attacking. The safest way to avoid Death Attack paralysis (other than immunity) is to constantly attack a placeable such as a door in order to stay in combat.
